pros: Great Culture and paid leave and broad range of teams
cons: Can give more remote work allowance

pros: They take care of their people in every way. Very impressive facility at the NYC headquarters, with all the comforts. Strong corporate structure to make sure no one is misused. Good, transparent leadership.
cons: Not really a con, but not a lot of handholding if you are a slow learner. They expect top-tier, smart work from every employee. If you want to move up from an administrative position, you will have to lobby for it - nothing will just fall in your lap here.

review_title: Best financial firm to work for
pros: great technology stack and smart people
cons: salary structure is not kind.

pros:
They desire to their employees succeed.
They are a well-known business that looks good on a resume.
cons:
Pay isn't very high.
Working environment is very serious and competitive.

pros: Fast paced. Not everyone may like that though.
cons: Long hours. I often stayed late.

pros: They pay a lot, even for entry level engineers.
cons: You feel restricted to certain skills.

review_title: It's everything like you think it is, and then some!
pros:
. If you are ambitious, the road to DC from Wall St is through Goldman Sachs
. Long hours are rewarded, incompetence is mercilessly crushed, survival of the fittest
cons:
. Coke, Addy usage very high, but discreet. So you never really know if you coworker is a rock star by birth, or from using stimulants
. Very alpha-male culture, as a woman it can sometimes be intimidating
advice_to_mgmt: . Accept and embrage usage of stimulants (esp w/ Millenials / Gen Z ) instead of making it taboo. You'll see productivity skyrocket as we will no longer be anxious.

pros: Flat Organization with positive involvement from senior management.
cons: High expectations that can cause "burn out"
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to empower junior analysts and provide transparency on their future growth.

pros: great training system to help young professions
cons: Work can be repetitive after a while

pros:
Decent enough bonus to get you hooked
Health center on site
cons:
Banking has impossible hours
Cookie cutter bland hires
Too many relatives of senior bankers
Such dated tech
advice_to_mgmt:
Upgrade tech because nobody actually believes it's a technology company
Trim down staff bloat
Hire more outside the Ivy's

review_title: Redundant back office task work, selfish management, constant cost cutting measures.
pros: A few managers and employees are bright and fun to work with.
cons: Constant cost cutting measures making it an increasingly less attractive place to work. Managers will set unrealistic mobility and flexibility expectations that they do not hold up to. Many managers entice new joiners by telling them there are opportunities for internal mobility or physical location mobility, which happens rarely. If you are okay with working a redundant back office role it's a good option, but things get boring quickly and value is not great for work life balance for how little the wages are.
advice_to_mgmt: Be a better corporation to work for.

pros:
Nice culture (as long as you work for a good manager)
Good Technology
cons: Need to be managing up and across - a lot to get ahead.

pros: Great working with so many smart people
cons: Long hours; serious unconscious gender bias amongst the sr. managers.

pros: Good salary, nice people, bonuses
cons: People can be condescending sometimes

review_title: Great Place if your willing to play the politics
pros: Easy work, good people.
cons:
The work is not challenging, the politics and managing up are the challenging part of the job. If you want to get promoted and get paid, you need to make sure you get in-front of your manager and your manager's manager regularly.

Do a good job, and promote yourself and manage up.

pros: Small groups are creating really interesting new things
cons: Long hours, low pay compared to competitors

pros: Brand recognition with Goldman Sachs
cons: Politics, should be a class on navigating through the corporate realm
advice_to_mgmt: Divide operations internship to middle office and back office internships

pros: The management is brilliant and believe in and value you.
cons: not great work life balance

pros: You are working with equally brilliant peers.
cons: There is not much room for growth.

pros: flexibility and completely new scenarios every single day meaning that you can start your day not knowing what is going to happen, can't say that about any other job
cons: long hours, the pressure to produce positive returns are always a massive burden, you have billions and billions of dollars of investor money on your back and is alway emotionally and mentally difficult.

pros: The people that you work with are great. You are able to provide great customer service to great people.
cons: Management is in it for themselves. They are really only worried about their careers and not worried about helping others try to succeed and move up within the company.

review_title: To be successful, know how to sell yourself
pros: Better opportunities if you are working in a flagship location (NY/NJ/Bangalore) or a growth business area
cons:
You need to know how to sell yourself to grow
Senior leadership roles are getting exceedingly competitive - very important to have a network with other senior leaders to grow
advice_to_mgmt:
Make reviews fair by incorporating NLP/Machine learning
Focus on Manager Effectiveness Feedback to coach your managers
Truly encourage mobility by ensuring each employee gets a new role every 3-5 years

pros: good working environment,work life balance
cons: slow, no cool benefits, no flexibility

pros: it was fun and learned a lot
cons: long hours! but bearable.

review_title: Only Looking At The Bottom Line
pros: Managers and peers are smart, helpful and hard working.
cons: MD's are totally out of touch
advice_to_mgmt: Listen to the VP's for a better culture and motivational techniques

pros: Great place to work and learn
cons: Long hours but a lot of deal flow

pros: Learned very much about finance
cons: Very intense culture and cutthroat

pros: Working on good modern technologies
cons: Work life balance varies by the team

pros: You learn from a diverse group of peers who are driven and ambitious. Gain tremendous business skills such as communication, attention to detail, financial savvy, understanding of businesses and investors, and importance of sales.
cons: The hours were really tough and most of the time the job that we were doing was to help the portfolio manager get more clients. Much of the job could be quite trivial at times and not very rewarding. In addition, the pay wasn't all that great.
advice_to_mgmt: Give opportunities to employees to thrive and work up the ladder through a merit based system. Set expectations up front with employees of what the job entails and if there is a match or interest from the employee's perspective.
